frameDefinitions: An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power.

The judge or other court officer (the Authority) informs the Accused of the Charges against him/her, i.e. the alleged actions and the relevant laws. '' 'The board has been accused by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.'
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.
A Communicator or Medium assigns linguistic meaning to an Unresolved_referent thereby identifying the specific actor or entity which fulfills the answer to this question.
A Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of Property (either real, such as land, or private).
frameExamples: The board has been <t>accused</t> by the federal court of making decisions based on narrow agendas and meddling where it shouldn't.
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
He cites the chief original observations <t>adduced</t> by Darwin as evidence for his theory.
Can you <t>name</t> all the U.S. Presidents?
The King <t>claims</t> this land and surrounding waters.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evader</fen> moves under its own power to <fen>Capture</fen> or contact with the <fen>Pursuer</fen>. Normally the <fen>Evader</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Pursuer</fen> is going after the <fen>Evader</fen> unless they act.
An actual or hypothetical  event in which the <fen>Pursuer</fen> takes physical control of the <fen>Evader</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the Evading occurs.
The judge or other authority of the court in which the accused person is arraigned.
The person being charged with an offense against the law.
The crime with which the Accused is charged
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who specifies the <fen>Role</fen> to be filled by the <fen>Specified_entity</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies as filling a particular <fen>Role</fen>.
A slot in a particular or generic event or relation whose filler the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen> to another person.
The thing to which the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> refers for identification purposes.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen> is conveyed.
When the the <fen>Communicator</fen> is makes the indication.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> indicates the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen>.
The Claimant asserts rights or priviliges, typically ownership, over some Property.
The <fen>Property</fen> is declared to be under the ownership of the <fen>Claimant</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The mouse</fex> eluded the cats for only a few minutes.
The mouse eluded <fex>the cats</fex> for only a few minutes.
Rýmirez-Sýnchez , tried in absentia , had evaded <fex>capture</fex> since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975
Smithers got away <fex>at the stroke of midnight</fex>.
<fex>Fred</fex> crawled the narrow passage.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
The scouts hiked <fex>through the desert</fex>.
The children skipped <fex>into the park</fex>.
The mouse scurried <fex>about</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
But<fex>Arturo Boncato Jr., marketing manager of the Marco Polo Hotel,</fex> cited the high occupancy rates in the hotels as proof of increasing visitors' confidence.
<fex>In a subsequent paper</fex> he adduced further evidence.

Reilly pointed <fex>to the high labor costs</fex> as the
main reason for the decision to close down the New Orleans facility.
TCI named the overly expensive bid price <fex>as the main reason for their strict opposition against a merger</fex>.

Persistent, heavy rainfall and poorly maintained drainage systems were cited
<fex>yesterday</fex> as the prime causes for the rising floodwaters
<fex>In Kuala Lumpur</fex>, he also pointed to the accountability/assessment arena as a place for new businesses to investigate.
<fex>When this is resolved</fex>, I will name the winner.
The king ordered <fex>the envoy</fex> to claim the land accross the river.
I claim <fex>this forest and environs</fex> in the name of the Queen.
